lang.name: en_CA
lang.key: Maintained by Madison Kelly (mkelly@alteeve.ca) for ScanCore.
[ #!string!scancore_brand_0001!# ] - #!variable!level!# - #!variable!subject!#

From: #!variable!from!# To: #!variable!to!# Subject: #!variable!subject!#
#!variable!body!#

-- This alert email was sent from the machine: - #!variable!hostname!#
It was generated by #!string!scancore_brand_0001!#, which is part of the #!string!scancore_brand_0002!# High-Availability platform.
This email was *not* sent by #!string!scancore_brand_0003!#. If you do not know why you are receiving this email, please speak to your system's administrator.
If you need any assistance, please feel free to contact #!string!scancore_brand_0003!# (#!string!scancore_brand_0004!#) and we will do our best to assist.
There has been a state change on #!variable!hostname!#
#!variable!title!#: #!variable!message!#
ScanCore
Anvil!
Alteeve's Niche!
https://alteeve.ca/w/Support

...free...

<function takes no arguments>
Found a scan agent: [#!variable!agent!#]
Starting agent: [#!variable!agent!#]...
Scan agent: [#!variable!agent!#] is checking if the DB(s) have their schemas loaded yet.
Table not found, need to load the schema.
Table found, schema does not need to be loaded.
#!variable!name1!#: [#!variable!value1!#], #!variable!name2!#: [#!variable!value2!#], #!variable!name3!#: [#!variable!value3!#]
Scan agent: [#!variable!agent!#] ran for: [#!variable!runtime!#] second(s).
The database: [#!variable!name!#] on: [#!variable!host!#] needs to have the: [#!variable!file!#] SQL schema loaded.
The DB table [#!variable!table!#] needs to be updated.
The DB table [#!variable!table!#] has not changed and does not need to be updated.
The DB table: [#!variable!table!#] needs to have: [#!variable!entry!#] added.
The DB table: [#!variable!table!#] needs to have it's: [#!variable!entry!#] entry updated.
The DB table: [#!variable!table!#] does not need to have it's: [#!variable!entry!#] entry updated; nothing changed.
Checking to see if the DB table: [#!variable!table!#] needs to have it's: [#!variable!entry!#] entry updated...

Updating DB with ID: [#!variable!id!#]. - The most up to date DB is: [#!variable!source_db_id!#] - It was last updated on: [#!variable!source_updated_time!#] - This DB was last updated on: [#!variable!target_last_updated!#]
This database appears to have no data, a complete copy is probably necessary (will verify per-table).
It is: [#!variable!seconds_behind!#] second(s) behind.
The DB with ID: [#!variable!id!#] is behind.
Recording alerts to: [#!variable!file!#].
#!variable!date!# - #!variable!alert_agent_name!# - #!variable!title!# - #!variable!message!#
Checking to see of the email relay file: [#!variable!postfix_relay_file!#] needs to be created or updated.
It exists, reading it.
The email details have changed, rewriting the relay file.
It doesn't exist, creating it.
Writing new relay file: [#!variable!postfix_relay_file!#].
Generating relay file's postmap binary DB.
Postfix configuration already backed up, skipping.
Reading in: [#!variable!postfix_main!#].
Inserting mail relay configuration.
Writing the updated postfix configuration file: [#!variable!postfix_main!#].
Restarting postfix.
Creating the alert email directory: [#!variable!email_directory!#].
Setting mode to: [#!variable!directory_mode!#].
No changes found.
Writing email file: [#!variable!file!#].
Sending the email stored in the file: [#!variable!file!#] now.
The user: [#!variable!user!#] is not interested in alert ID: [#!variable!alert_uuid!#] (title: [#!variable!title!#], message: [#!variable!message!#]).
One of the 'alerts::recipient::X::...' entries in the configuration file appears to be malformed and was ignored.
*** There were no alerts from this scan. ***
*** One or more alerts were sent this scan. ***
Unable to update the health file: [#!variable!health_file!#]. Is the node out of the cluster? This will not matter if so because the node won't be a migration target anyway.
The email directory: [#!variable!email_directory!#] exists already.
There are no nodes in emergency-stop, so no recovery is needed.
There are no cache files on this machine, so it is not possible to boot the emergency-stop nodes.

I was asked to boot the node: [#!variable!node!#] but I wasn't able to read the 'power_check_command' from it's cache file. Does the cache file exist? If not, next time the node is online, use this #!string!scancore_brand_0001!# dashboard to view its #!string!scancore_brand_0002!#. This will cause the cache file to be generated for future use.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] was booted back up successfully.
Failed to boot the node: [#!variable!node!#]. Tried using the shell call: [#!variable!shell_call!#] which should have returned the code '0' but: [#!variable!rc!#] was returned.
Post-scan checks and tasks completed.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is not ready to boot yet.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] was cleanly shut off so it will be left off.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] will not be booted because 'scancore::disable::boot_nodes' is set in [#!data!path::striker_config!#].
#!string!scancore_brand_0001!# has been disabled, exiting. The program will restart automatically within one minute of being re-enabled.
#!string!scancore_brand_0001!# has started.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is set to a timed reboot which has now expired, booting it back up.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is set to a timed reboot which is: [#!variable!time_left!#] in the future. Leaving it off.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is off but booting nodes has been disabled via: 'scancore::disable::boot_nodes' in: [#!data!path::striker_config!#] so it will be left off.
#!string!scancore_brand_0001!# invoked with '--force', running regardless of '#!data!path::striker_config!#' setting.
Enabled #!string!scancore_brand_0001!# successfully. It will start within one minute.
Disabled #!string!scancore_brand_0001!# successfully. It will exit within one minute.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is now on, clearing the 'boot_delayed' alert.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is now on, clearing the 'scancore::disable::boot_nodes' alert.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is now on, clearing the 'node_clean_off' alert.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] is now on, clearing the 'node_not_ready' alert.
The power feeding this machine has entered a warning state.
The temperature of this machine has entered a warning state!
The power feeding this machine has entered a critical state.
The temperature of this machine has entered a critical state!
The power feeding this machine has returned to a healthy state.
The temperature of this machine has returned to a healthy state!
#!string!scancore_brand_0001!# was invoked with '--one-shot' and the run is finished, exiting.

Failed to connect to database: [#!variable!name!#] on host: [#!variable!host!#:#!variable!port!#].
Is the server running and does the firewall allow connections on TCP port: [#!variable!port!#]?
The password was not passed, and it is required. Please set: [scancore::db::#!variable!id!#::password = <password>] in: [#!variable!config_file!#].

The user name: [#!variable!user!#] on the host: [#!variable!host!#] is either not the owner of the database: [#!variable!name!#], or the password for that user is incorrect. - Please edit: [#!variable!config_file!#] * If the user name is not correct, please update: scancore::db::#!variable!id!#::user = <user> * If the user name is correct, please update: scancore::db::#!variable!id!#::password = <password>
The error was: ---------- #!variable!dbi_error!# ----------
The database: [#!variable!name!#] on host: [#!variable!host!#] with ID: [#!variable!id!#] can not be used, skipping it.
Error during DB 'do'. The error was: ---------- #!variable!dbi_error!# ----------
There were errors writing data to the database. Rolling back!
There was an unknown variable: [#!variable!variable!#] with the value: [#!variable!value!#]. Please check the 'alerts::recipient::X::email' entries.
There was an unknown variable: [#!variable!variable!#] with the value: [#!variable!value!#]. Please check the 'alerts::recipient::X::file' entries.
The connection to the database: [#!variable!name!#] on host: [#!variable!host!#:#!variable!port!#] was refused. Is the database server running?
The node: [#!variable!node!#] has entered a 'warning' state. Warning: If the peer goes critical, it will not migrate to this node and instead gracefully shut down it's server.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] has returned to being healthy. It is again a migration target should the peer go into emergency shutdown.

The connection to the database: [#!variable!name!#] on host: [#!variable!host!#:#!variable!port!#] failed because the name could not be translated to an IP address. Is this database setup in '/etc/hosts'?
Failed to disable #!string!scancore_brand_0001!#!
Failed to enable #!string!scancore_brand_0001!#!

This machine has dropped below the minimum hold-up threshold but automatic power-shutdown is disabled via 'scancore::disable::power_shutdown = 0'. The machine will continue to run until the last UPS loses output power!

This machine has risen above the maximum temperature thresholds but automatic thermal-shutdown is disabled via 'scancore::disable::thermal_shutdown = 0'. The machine will continue to run until the hardware shutdown is triggered or the machine fails!
This machine has dropped below the minimum hold-up threshold. Shutdown will soon begin!
This machine has risen above the maximum temperature thresholds. Shutdown will soon begin!
Shutdown output: [#!variable!line!#]

Mains power has been lost. Remaining *estimated* hold-up time is: [#!variable!highest_holdup_time!# seconds]. Shutdown will occur when the hold-up time drops below: [#!variable!minimum_ups_runtime!# seconds].
Failed to read the amount of RAM is being used by: [#!variable!program_name!#]. To be safe, the program will exit at the end of this sweep.
Exiting because of errors. The reason(s) will be logged above.
Connection to the database: [#!variable!name!#] on host: [#!variable!host!#:#!variable!port!#] has been re-established.
Failed to prepare the database query: [#!variable!query!#] on: [#!variable!server!#]. The error was: [#!variable!db_error!#].
Failed to execute the database query: [#!variable!query!#] on: [#!variable!server!#]. The error was: [#!variable!db_error!#].
Failed to read the file: [#!variable!shell_call!#]. The error was: [#!variable!error!#].
Failed to connect to any database, unable to proceed.
Not ID passed to the AN::Tools::DB->initialize_db() method.
Failed to call: [#!variable!shell_call!#]. The error was: [#!variable!error!#].
No ID passed to the AN::Tools::DB->load_schema() method.
No schema file passed to the AN::Tools::DB->load_schema() method.
The schema file: [#!variable!file!#] passed to the AN::Tools::DB->load_schema() method was not found.
The schema file: [#!variable!file!#] passed to the AN::Tools::DB->load_schema() method was found but could not be read.
The AN::Tools::DB->do_db_write() method was called without a query.
Failed to do an update or insert the database query: [#!variable!query!#] on: [#!variable!server!#]. The error was: [#!variable!db_error!#].
Too much RAM being used! Using: [#!variable!used_ram!#], maximum allowed: [#!variable!maximum_ram!#].
It looks like a loop was hit trying to find a unique file name for storing an email. I got to: [#!variable!file!#] before giving up.
The node: [#!variable!node!#] has gone into "emergency stop" and is shutting down!

The node: [#!variable!node!#] has reaches an "emergency stop" threshold, but the automatic shutdown feature has been disabled! Please manually shut down the machine (or fix the problem) as soon as possible.

The local machine's UUID was not read properly. It should be stored in: [#!data!sys::host_uuid!#] and contain hexadecimal characters in the format: '012345-6789-abcd-ef01-23456789abcd'. If this file exists and if there is a string in the file, please verify that it is structured correctly. Please do not simply replace it! All sensor data that was read by this host is mapped back to this machine using that UUID. Generating a new UUID will disconnect that historical data from this machine.

Failed to send an alert because this host is not yet in the database. This can happen on the very first run of #!string!scancore_brand_0001!# when the peer is not accessible so the initial attempt to connect to the DB fails and tries to register an alert before this host gets into the DB. If this is the case, this warning can be ignored. * Details of the alert: - Type: [#!variable!type!#] - Sent By: [#!variable!alert_sent_by!#] - Record Locator: [#!variable!alert_record_locator!#] - Name: [#!variable!alert_name!#] - Timestamp: [#!variable!modified_date!#]
I was asked to query the database: [#!variable!server!#], but the connection is down. This should never happen and is probably a bug.
It appears that #!string!scancore_brand_0001!# has not yet run on this host. The host's UUID is: [#!variable!uuid!#] which is not in the 'hosts' table.
Starting #!string!scancore_brand_0001!#:
[ #!variable!title!# ] - #!variable!message!#
Another copy of #!string!scancore_brand_0001!# is running, exiting.
This change was not anticipated. Please report it (#!string!brand_0012!#) so that we can improve #!string!brand_0019!# by catching this change in the future.
#!string!scancore_brand_0001!# has been enabled. It will start within one minute.
#!string!scancore_brand_0001!# has been disabled. It will exit when the next sweep is called.
